Hello!

This is DAKSA Web Presentation Template

Source file: DAKSA Design Repo

An example

This is a sample presentation that shows you what it can do.

Vertical Slides

Slides can be nested inside of each other.

Use the Space or Arrow key to navigate through all slides.

Nested element 01

Nested slides are useful for adding additional detail underneath a high level horizontal slide.

If the bottom arrow on the bottom right turn cyan, it indicates this particular slide has nested element(s).

Nested element 02

That's it, time to go back up.

Birds Eye View

Press ESC to enter the slides birds eye view.

Hold down alt and click on any element to zoom in on it. Alt + click anywhere to zoom back out.

Touch Devices Support

This presentation template will work perfectly on touch devices, like mobile phones and tablets. Simply swipe through your slides.

Fragments

Hit the Right arrow or Bottom arrow key

to step through

a fragmented slide.

This is a sample note for fragmented slide.

Fragment Styles

There's different types of fragments, like:

grow

shrink

fade-out

fade-up (also down, left and right!)

current-visible

Highlight red blue green

Transition Styles

You can select from different transitions, like:
None - Fade - Slide - Convex - Concave - Zoom

Themes

There are two theme options for this template, Dark (default) & Light.

Slide Backgrounds

Set data-background="#3d3935" on a slide to change the background color. All CSS color formats are supported.

Image Backgrounds

<section data-background="path-to-image.png">

Tiled Backgrounds

<section data-background="image.png" data-background-repeat="repeat" data-background-size="100px">

Video Backgrounds

<section data-background-video="video.mp4,video.webm">

... and GIFs!

Background Transitions

Different background transitions are available via the backgroundTransition option. This one's called "zoom".

Reveal.configure({ backgroundTransition: 'zoom' })

Background Transitions

You can override background transitions per-slide.

<section data-background-transition="zoom">

Pretty Code


function linkify( selector ) {
	if( supports3DTransforms ) {

		var nodes = document.querySelectorAll( selector );

		for( var i = 0, len = nodes.length; i < len; i++ ) {
		var node = nodes[i];

		if( !node.className ) {
		node.className += ' roll';
		}
		}
	}
}

Code syntax highlighting courtesy of highlight.js.

Tabular Tables

Item Value Quantity
Apples $1 7
Lemonade $2 18
Bread $3 2

Quotation

Inline quote: “The nice thing about standards is that there are so many to choose from”

and block quote

“For years there has been a theory that millions of monkeys typing at random on millions of typewriters would reproduce the entire works of Shakespeare. The Internet has proven this theory to be untrue.”

Hyperlink between slides

You can link between slides internally, like this.

Speaker View

It includes a timer, preview of the upcoming slide, as well as your speaker notes.

Press the S key to try it out.

Hello fucker! You again huh? Damn you!

Take a Break?

Press B or . on your keyboard to pause the presentation. This will helps you to 'sleep' off the screen.

That's it!
